Reviews.Title: “A Very Good choice for the area around the Phoenix airport”
Reviews.Author: ynapa456
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and found the room to be an outstanding value. The king size bed was most comfortable and the entire room/bathroom was clean and well maintained. But I was most impressed with the staff. Their were friendly and most professional, everyone from the front desk to the shuttle van driver. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. My one suggestion is for them to better emphasis the metro that stops in fron of the hotel. They could provide information on fares and suggested sights at the various stops.

Reviews.Title: “Finvey review: close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Finvey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the ninth floor for three days and two nights on business. I was very pleased with several aspects: I had a comfortable king size bed, a small fridge that worked, a small microwave that worked, a one cup coffee maker that worked, an iron that worked, a flat screen ~40" screen that worked, an upgraded fitness room, an outdoor hot tub, a bar downstairs with afternoon food and drink specials along with friendly bartenders, good breakfast, a free airport shuttle with a friendly and accomodating driver, friendly front desk staff, and very close proximity to the airport. The downside: the neighborhood surrounding the hotel is not the best. Keeping that in mind, I would definitely stay here again and would feel comfotable bringing my family, but I wouldn't be walking around outside the hotel after dark. (CB)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: We recently used their facility for a four day regional sales training/sales meeting location. The entire staff was extremely friendly, helpful, pro-active and competent. The meals were very good by hotel standards and the guest rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. We would definitely come back to this hotel for future meetings in the Phoenix vicinity. Some improvables are that the facility probably should be renovated in the next few years and some meeting rooms are relatively small with air walls that do not isolate sound very well. Overall, we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantrippers
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was for a room with a king bed with a queen pullout sofa. We were given a handicapped room with one double bed and no where in the washroom for any toiletries. If you don't want the additional cost of valet parking, be prepared to drag your luggage to the parking elevator, down, back inside the hotel, and over to another elevator. The airplanes nearby weren't too bad but the nearby trains kept me up most of the night. Every time you turn off your mobile device, you have to log into the wifi service all over again. This was our last night in Arizona. How disappointing to end our trip this way.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but less than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, but I expected more. I was surprised that the room has no mini fridge or microwave. My room faced the street with the light rail station, which was too noisy for my taste. The staff was very accommodating, especaily when I could not get business documents to print from there guest computers. The dresser in the room was very cheap. To open lower drawers I had to hold the top drawers closed. Overall the room had a bit of a rundown feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great improvement”
Reviews.Author: Gottatrav
Reviews.Content: I was really happy to see the improvements made to the hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly just like last time. My room was clean but the real bonus was that my room had a new flat screen tv instead of the old style ones. The front desk lady said they just finished all the rooms. I could tell from my last stay to this one that they are "freshening up" the hotel. Enjoyed my breakfast too! Oh, tried the lightrail since it stops in front of the hotel. Very easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Logan L
Reviews.Content: Stay here for business. Carpet was not vacuumed and room had general unkept look. Went to use coffee mug and it was caked with oatmeal. Night table looked like a load of semen was dried on it. Gross. Called and complained and they offered me a free breakfast. Needless to say I did not have an appetite.

Reviews.Title: “A six day stay was six days too long! Lesson learned!!”
Reviews.Author: chinamarie
Reviews.Content: My overall experience was less than desirable, I payed in advance for the king conc rm when I checked in and was in my room housekeeping came in saying she needed to clean rm, the refrigerator was unstable and unplugged (which I soon found out why), the rm was small nothing like what the pic illustrated, the tv kept going out, the desk clock didn't work and 1 of the 4 elevators was broke 3 out of the 6 days I was here! I'm extremely thrilled to check out today!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY BEFORE A FLIGHT”
Reviews.Author: WEISSBIER
Reviews.Content: True, the hotel is a bit dated, but they try their best and we didn't mind staying here, Popcorn ceilings, old tube TV, a trip back in time, but the bed is comfortable, shower worked great. The room was clean, no complaints. The views are impeccable if you are on a higher floor, try getting one on the west side for a spectacular sunset. There was a parking fee of $ 2.00 per night, the airport shuttle ran every 15 minutes. They have a nice bar downstairs and a restaurant which served breakfast buffet style. We recommend this hotel if one needs a place to stay a night before or after a flight. If you need to park a car for the duration of a trip up to 14 days, this Crowne Plaza offers great Park and Sleep rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased family”
Reviews.Author: teenie_g2008
Reviews.Content: We loved how nice, clean, quiet & ODOR free this place was. The decor was calming & simple. Was not very happy with hotel stay that you ALSO have to pay for PARKING! THAT was not cool, but it is what it is. Old TV's...I feel that should be included as it is w/est Western & MANY other hotels & finally, perhaps more than one decaf & one regular coffee would be nice too. But my husband & I went with our 5 yr old son...we all had a good time. The pool was clean & warm. Hotel staff was pleasant (excluding the front desk who was cordial at max) but all the help was very pleasant. Circle K & Ruby Tuesdays across the street, about 3 miles or so away was IHOP, the zoo & LOTS of other stuff was also a hop, skip, & jump away. GREAT location...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BrianGNC
Reviews.Content: Amazing breakfast each morning. Buffet style with made to order omelets! Clean and comfortable rooms and very friendly staff! TVs do need updated and it is close to the railroad but I didn't notice the trains. You would not need a rental car staying at this hotel. Easy access by light rail to the city and several other cities in AZ. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: PanchoBedfordUK
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there quite a few times in the last couple of years. The place need modernising throughout. The rooms still have old tube TV's! The bar & restaurant are both old & uncomfortable. Very noisy at night due to the railroad, which although some distance away, the train horns carry on all night!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay--great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gottatrav
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay. We got a great room rate and the staff was really amazing. I needed some help and they really went above and beyond. Room was comfortable and appreciated not having to pay for internet. Ill be back. Thanks susan!

Reviews.Title: “I thought I would be more Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MLLINNJ
Reviews.Content: I was a little surprised at the condition of the hotel and my guest room. There are old TV's in the rooms, the paint is peeling on the wall, carpets are stained and there is a lot of dust. I was expecting better for Crowne Plaza. There is a little "cafe" and when I was there in the morning, there was a note that the attendant was gone and would return, stood there for about 5 minutes and then left for my meeting. The restaurant was "OK" and I found it weird that they were out to steaks...I thought that was a "staple" in any hotel restaurant. However, the staff that I encountered throughout the hotel seemed pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me...”
Reviews.Author: nbalsari
Reviews.Content: I booked this one in the midnight through Hotwire and arrived 20 minutes after the initial booking. Outdated, dark lobby at that hour but as it is in close proximity to the airport and had comfy beds it was fine for sleeping for a couple of hours before I take my early morning flight. However, the smart... OK, wise-guy in the reception told in a very annoying way that the company that runs the car park (even though it is integrated to the hotel property) applies charges for the car park. I reserved the hotel through Hotwire and did not read the fine print in the tinny screen of the Iphone. Even though I am very well aware that some airport or midtown hotels charge extra for the car park, I was a bit unhappy to face that hidden cost in the middle of the night( a 145 USD hotel asking for 5 USD additional for car park...). But the receptionist who travelled half of the world last year and waiting for his next vacation this year to travel the rest, gave me my lesson in the middle of the night with a grin on his face, and told me that he has not been in a hotel without a parking charge lately. After taking my long deserved 5 USD lesson ı was waiting for his next wise move. At this moment, he asked my plans with my car...I did not dare to ask for other options (!) and accepted to pay the 5 USD additional fee to crawl into my bed in my room that faces to the tires and pumpers of the cars (yes, it was facing to the carpark’s floor, no, the company that runs the car park did not ask for an additional fee for the view.) As the behavior of the staff against the customers shows the general approach of the hotel management to its customers, I'd not stay at this location or recommend this location to my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid_Julie-n-Dan
Reviews.Content: If you need to be close to the Phoenix airport for an early departure, this is a great location. The facility/room was clean, comfortable, and quiet considering its proximity to the airport. Booked through Hotwire, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Thomas D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza near the Phoenix Airport 12/11. The staff was excellent, they welcomed me, gave me a snack and had my key packet ready, I walked up, signed my name and was off to my room. Very convenient shuttle service to the airport on a very regular schedule. Location is perfect, stores and restaurants within a short walking distance, light rail access literally at the front door will take you to downtown Tempe (ASU) or downtown Phoenix for a little night life or dining in either direction. Breakfast buffet here is as good as any you will have at an airport hotel, fresh fruit, hot food and an omelet station. I will be back on my next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to the airport. Comfortable and dated”
Reviews.Author: Pantunes
Reviews.Content: I spent one night during a layover in PHX, and it was OK. This hotel offers free shuttle every 15 min and is the closest to the airport. The internet is also free in the rooms, as well as a business center is free. The rooms are a bit dated, such as the custain was falling apart, the bathtub was leaking, and they have no central A/C, but rather those old ones by the window. But the bed was very comfortable and this was was like any other older Sheraton or upper-IN i've stayed. Basically a very clean convenient and confortable choice for PHX airport, nothing special. The Delta Airlines crews stay here. Another place next to the crowne plaza is th ALOFT, which is newer.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and thought it was fine. The hotel is a bit warn, as other reviewers remark, it is not a glamorous place, but the room was clean and comfortable. There is a decent breakfast buffet, they make excellent omelettes for you. The staff at the front desk was nice and helpful. Free wifi was also great. THe only disappointment is that we had to pay $5 for parking, I mean, paying for parking in the most sprawled city in the US was a bit of a joke! But other than that, this is a perfectly nice and clean option if you arrive late at the airport and leave the next morning. We got a really good deal for this hotel through Priceline (we named our price and the hotel accepted the offer).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: justjo30
Reviews.Content: I had a very short night at this property and wished I could have slept better. Rooms and common areas are tired. Just overall less than thrilled with my stay. Only plus, is close proximity to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Guitarplay
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Good value. Breakfast buffet was great offering hot and cold items along with made to order omelets and waffles. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna make it go to rehab...”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and welcoming. The place is just in need of some rehab. The neighborhood seems a little sketchy. Located very close to the airport it's convenient when you don't want to be far from PHX. Spent the next two nights at the Holiday Inn Suites a few blocks north. It was like a resort in comparison. Crowne Plaza really needs to do a better job protecting their brand because there are some well kept properties and then you have ones like this.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be.....”
Reviews.Author: Azdaizy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times in the past couple of years due to rail being close by. 11/19/11 was the last time I will stay here. The room had an odor but I didn't have time to deal with it. I had to wait an hr to get a remote for TV. By the time I went to bed I realized AC didn't work. After waiting an hr for remote I was not gonna wait for something to be done about AC. The lamps in the Rm were damaged..1 was wobbly & the other shade was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Has acts together -- except for maintenance and safety!”
Reviews.Author: Want2GoHome
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a few times on points. All weekend stays. The hotel is generally slower on weekends according to the staff and the lounge is closed. Staff is very friendly. Check-in process is well prepared - they always have my folio ready with the Platinum amenities. Room assigned according to preference but you might have to ask for an elite upgrade. Room is the standard CP room. Old style TV. Some might feel a little small. It seems the rooms are of slightly different sizes. Bathroom is nice. Noise could be an issue as it is near the airport (you can see it from the even numbered side), by the light rail and there is another railroad running somewhere (could hear trains late into the night). It seems to me the higher odd number rooms would be quieter as it is farthest away from the light rail and airport. If you like plane watching, get the even numbered rooms. Restaurant service is efficient. Food is not great but OK. Service is pretty good. Internet is wireless and pretty fast (at least for weekends). Neighborhood is OK - relatively safe by Phoenix standards. There is a Ruby Tuesday's across the street or walk north on 44th to the Chinese Cultural Center for Chinese. Do not walk past the Chinese Cultural Center on 44th - the neighborhood gets a little worse. Light rail stop is right in front of the hotel - convenient to Downtown Tempe and Downtown Phoenix. Hotel charges overnight parking but it is free during the day. My biggest problem with the hotel is the maintenance. Lots of little things are broken in the rooms - lights, safes. On my latest stay, I told the front desk when I checked out but the guy did not write it down or anything. Maybe that is why things never get fixed. Got upgraded to connecting rooms sometimes and you need to be very careful - check the lock of the connecting room that does not have the bed. They tend to be unlocked! Also noticed they had some furniture in the hallway leading to the fire exit - pretty sure that is a fire code violation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Hsintien
Reviews.Content: Noisy because the hotel is so closed to the airport and light rail station, plus the bus and the parking area. The hotel gives guests ear plugs and eye mask, I think maybe due to the noise and its half window curtain. The smell of the hotel is bad, and the room is old. I should've looked the reviews before I came. But I canceled the rest of four days reservation and moved to Hilton Suites, Phoenix, which is still the number 1 for me.

Reviews.Title: “Organizational Meetings”
Reviews.Author: Aaron H
Reviews.Content: I told one of the people at the front desk that I have never seen service like I did at your hotel. I am not sure if you just had a costumer service conference, but the people at the hotel were outstanding! I would give you a ten out of ten on your people. From the front desk to the restaurant everyone had smiles, were quick to respond with polite kindness. The facilities were also clean and welcoming. I loved the proximity to the "Light Rail". We had 37 people come and now one needed an airport pick up or a rental car, because you had a shuttle running every 15-20 minutes and our people just jumped on the light rail out side the front door of the hotel. I was seriously blown away. I heard others give a similar report. Thank you so much for working with us. You provided us with a great value. Anything we do in the future your hotel will be first on the list. Thank you for your professionalism. If you are planning a corporate or organizational event in phoenix than this is the Hotel. God Bless, Aaron Higginbotham P.S. The Breakfast was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “"A Hotel Botox is needed now"”
Reviews.Author: JerBear0920
Reviews.Content: My wife checked in on a Sunday Evening thinking it would be a upscale hotel but we was wrong on the room. The room was to have plus feeling being on the Concierge Level it was false advertising in the Room Type on their reservation web site 1st Problem fridge was broken no power cord,"80's TV w/bad reception, top it off phones didn't work. The heating and cooling unit a old motel type outside/inside wall unit very loud when running couldn't hardly her ourself talking in the room.Call for Maint. Man who could not repair the frige and front desk claimed the phones were ok but we had to use our cell phone to call the front desk from our room. Front desk not very helpful the Maint.Man told the front desk we need another room after 35 minutes they could move us directly across the Hall !! The restaurant staff was excelllent and the two bellman were the only postive thing we could find and say for this hotel. The management need to update this hotel now !!Excellent location but a tired appearing hotel and front desk needs some Guest Manners Training Classes !!

Reviews.Title: “An aging hotel with a lot of heart”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGateGirl2011
Reviews.Content: There's no denying that the Crowne Plaza Airport Hotel needs a gentle facelift. The rooms are aging and it has the feel of a building in need of some TLC. What it does have going for it are the people working there. The front desk staff are kind and welcoming. After a lengthy stay for work, they took the time to learn our names, greet us in the morning and celebrate our successes when we returned at night. When I called for a wake-up call they were always nice, no matter how late it was. Everyone from the restaurant staff to the housekeeping staff greeted us throughout our stay with genuine kindness. Yes, the rooms could use a fresh update. However, they are spacious, the hallways are quiet, the vending machines are stocked and housekeeping added thoughtful touches here and there throughout my room. The lobby even has a beautiful baby grand piano for guests to play. Two things I would have loved: better pillows and better lighting. For some reason all the lights are covered with yellow shades making it hard to see and even harder to get ready in the morning. But, at the end of the day, its truly caring and efficient staff and its heart...made a hotel feel a little more like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: dp191244
Reviews.Content: Lobby unwelcoming but check-in staff pleasant and efficient. Room ready for some attention and windows so dirty difficult to see through. Breakfast next morning brightened things up, good buffet and again staff bright and helpful. David P

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Onewithall
Reviews.Content: We chose this because it was close to the airport and we had an early flight out and also because it had a restaurant where we hoped to have dinner, as we had returned our rental car in the afternoon after checking in. It was just OK but we would not choose to stay here again. The restaurant was dreadful. The room was spacious enough, but the air conditioner was so noisy even on a low setting it was hard to sleep. The bathroom floor was not immaculate and I found long dark hairs near the tub. I thought that the Crowne Plaza brand had a good reputation but this was quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but still paying for my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and got a good deal to stay at the Crowne this last weekend. The lobby and staff were wonderful when we arrived. However, when we got up to our room, it was nothing special. I found a bag of stale chips in the armoire drawer with a variety of spices and plates and bowls. The chips had spilled out all over the drawer. I was concerned by finding this because it made me wonder if the cleaning service did not include checking dresser drawers, they probably don't change the sheets either. We intended to use the hide away bed for the kids but once we pulled it out and realized how disgusting and uncomfortable it looked, chose to let the kids sleep with us. The next day as I reviewed my bank account I realized that not only had priceline charged my card for our stay but the hotel double charged it as well! The staff assured me it would be corrected right away. Finally, yesterday (Tuesday) it was put back in my account. This morning, I found that they had placed yet ANOTHER charge to my card. I called and was tranferred to the accounting department where I left a message. Hopefully, they can correct it for good this time. What I do find interesting however, is the fact that even after all of this inconvenience, not once have they offered anything to compensate my troubles. Give me a free parking pass if I ever stay again or something! I don't really get the feeling they care too much about returning guests and business.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rich m
Reviews.Content: They brag that they are the closest hotel to the airport but in spite of 2 calls from the airport, the shuttle never came. Rust stain in the tub and no stopper. Very loud a/c. Carpet dirty in room with french fries visible under the bed from who knows how long ago. Hair left on counter in bathroom and on carpet in the couch area of the room. I found the $14 charge for a buffet breakfast outrageous. On the credit side the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS REALLY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: itsmedb
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review because I felt this hotel deserved more praise than it already received. This is our first time staying here and we are very impressed with the decor and also the cleanliness and friendly staff. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are very nicely decorated with white linens and nice carpet and beautiful bathroom. The bathroom looks recently redone to me. If you see reviews that are less than praiseworthy don't believe them. This hotel is worth every dime we paid and I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Hopsgrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight before an early flight and thought the place was very nice. It's billed as the closest hotel to the airport and it was conveniently close. They have a 24-hr shuttle which was nice. The room had a very comfortable bed and nice shower. It didn't have a flat screen TV but I really didn't care. I had dinner in the lounge and the food was quite good and the bartender was nice. I didn't have any problems and would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok.”
Reviews.Author: Adrie v
Reviews.Content: Comfortably located near the airport and a good value through priceline ($45). The hotel is a bit dated but the rooms are still up to date. Microwave and small fridge come in handy, as well as the nice lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmm....”
Reviews.Author: stooreyruaridh
Reviews.Content: First of all, very good location. Right by the airport and really quick and easy to get to. Got there and checked in, lady was very nice at the check in. Got up to our room and it looked OK. We were really tired as we had flown Frankfurt, Germany - Dallas, TX - Phoenix AZ and had done 25 hours since we left our house in Germany. It was really really warm there so we switched on Air Con. It was soo noisy it seemed louder then the planes from the airport. It did cool us down, but it was hard to get to sleep with the rumbling working noise from that thing. We arrived during monsoon season, so we were told to expect a bit of rain. 2am in the morning and there was a thunder storm, I'm not going to blame nature on the hotel, but you could here every little rumble of thunder like it was the air con again. And the lightning was so light it looked like somebody was switching on and off the light, whilst doing the same with the air con for the thunder. From 00:00 until 07:00 it rained solid constantly. The morning after, I woke up to go to the window, only to step in what felt like the Pacific Ocean. The windows had flooded due to the quantity of the rain. The bed was comfortable and cosy, but overall a slight let down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: listeve
Reviews.Content: Located close to the airport with a free shuttle service that runs on demand (from airport) and on the half-hour (to airport) this is a nice place to stay if you don't mind being in an industrial area. If you have a car there's no problem in getting around and finding places to eat. If, like me, you're limited to the hotel restaurant that's no problem either. The restaurant has moderately priced menu and the food is definitely better than most hotel fare. This hotel is well kept and a good buy. I'd recommend it to a friend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property close to the airport and the light rail”
Reviews.Author: bconwayOU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the airport Crowne Plaza for 2 nights to use as a base to attend the Rush concert and get back to the airport for a relatively early flight out the next morning after the concert. The hotel was great for a couple of days, shuttle to/from terminals, friendly staff, decent breakfast buffet, TGI Fridays, CircleK, and light rail across the street.Took the light rail downtown - very easy access west to downtown and east to Tempe and ASU. Really no workout facility to speak of, and the pool is small, but other than that it is a great place to stay for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Good clen hotel that is close to PHX”
Reviews.Author: countyfan2020
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel that is nice & close to PHX. Rooms are big, bed is comfortable. Only downside is that we asked for sofa bed to be made up (it wasn't - even after asking at the front desk to make sure it had) & then having to chase extra bedding from the front desk. There is a handy K mart 50yrds walk which is good for drink/snacks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Coolerweather
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-law were married on Saturday. Crowne Plaza Phx Airport held our reception. Everyone we worked with was professional and very competent. Valerie and George made sure everything went smoothly. The food was great and so was the service. My aunt and uncle got lost and Valerie gave them directions and stayed on the phone with them until they arrived. She went above and beyond to make the reception special for us. The suite they put the newlyweds in was beautiful and it was included in the price of the reception. Our DJ said he was impressed with how Crowne Plaza treated him, offering help and making sure he was on the "same page" with the schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a bit more and go with another hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjg8237
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and each stay gets a little worse. First, their housekeeping staff is just incompetent. I have had several nights where I came back to the room from meetings at about 7pm and the room was still not cleaned. Then two times the room was not cleaned at all. The straw that broke the camels back was last week when I checked in with a prepaid reservation and they said they may not have any rooms--they did--but when I got to my room the bathroom was not cleaned (towels on the floor, no toiletries)--I called the front desk and they assured me that they would remedy the situation, but an hour later they still had not arrived. When I complained they next morning, while polite, did nothing to give me an incentive to return. So I won't--I travel to Phoenix for business two weeks out of each month, so they lost a very good customer. The elevators are always broken. The restaurant is terrible. But thank god, everyone is friendly about the crappy hotel they work in!

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel, Not for young families.”
Reviews.Author: travelho_10
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on Hotwire, we had short notice and with it being spring break, most hotels were sold out or way above our budget, so we booked here because of the great price and 3.5 star rating. I must say that the staff was VERY friendly and helpful besides one lady. But we were disappointed in the very small room, and tight bathroom. Right after checking in I noticed trash (the last guests) behind the garbage can, so that made me feel if they missed such obvious cleaning, I wondered what I couldn't see that wasn't cleaned!! There was a STRONG party vibe in the hotel, so if you are single or looking for that, I think this hotel would be fine. We saw prostitutes walk through the lobby. (I should say women who strongly looked to be hookers, ) I am sure the hotel doesn't allow this, but they did walk through. they had many condoms for sale in the lobby store! The pool was so nice and warm, but once again, a little party always going on, everyone always had their beer in hand, and it was sometimes uncomfortable with kids, when there are 5 drunk men telling stories while you are trying to swim in the afternoon! One night we were met my drunk men outside OUR hotel room door, when we were coming back from dinner, with our small children. One of them had passed out and they were pushing him on a luggage cart! We got a little giggle out of it, but my kids didn't need to see that! It was a great opportunity to explain the dangers of alcohol. None of this is the hotels fault, it just seemed to attract this kind of clientele. I was also a little annoyed that their morning "cafe" that served muffins, yogurt and coffee was closed Saturday and Sundays? We were there over the weekend, and walked down to get the kids breakfast to find they are only open weekdays, so we had to walk to the gas station across the street to get donuts and milk! My only complaint about the staff was one evening they were out of pool towels, and my kids were already swimming. I called the front desk and asked for more towels and no one ever brought any! The room was clean enough, and the staff was friendly. Parking was very reasonably priced. The hotel seems to cater to business men flying in for a quick hook up, and party. So if you are up for a party you should stay here, if you are bringing your kids, maybe look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with cheerful, courteous, helpful employees.”
Reviews.Author: boatmisser
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for anybody who needs to stay near the airport. The surrounding neighborhood is a bit sketchy, an industrial area with the occasional adult-entertainment establishment, but the hotel is great, the customer service even greater. I got the feeling that everybody likes their jobs and enjoys working there. My compliments to management for providing such an atmosphere. The customer service at check-in and check-out is efficient and super-friendly. The waitstaff in the restaurant and bar are also very helpful and courteous. The breakfast chef will make you an omelet or cook your eggs to order right there in front of you, and he'll do it with an honest smile on his face. The rooms are great, and it's actually possible to get some peace, quiet, and sleep in there. They have regular shuttle service to the terminals, and there's a light rail train stop right out in front. No train noise, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Sleazy vibe, not for families.”
Reviews.Author: shannonwithkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a good price from priceline. It is a pretty standard set up for a Crowne Plaza. I was really grossed out to discover advertisements for local strip clubs and ‘massage’ services right in the Guest Services Book in the room. It made me feel like they cater to sleazy clientele and that I brought my kids to the wrong place. Close to the airport but not much else. Ridiculous parking charge. I was glad to be out of there.

Reviews.Title: “not a 3 1/2 star /smelly room and filthy carpets, dim lighting”
Reviews.Author: gogirl02
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport/ We were told by hotwire this was a 3 1/2 star hotel /but we were not happy with the small smelly room, dim lighting which made it difficult to put make up on. There was no hot water for our shower in the morning! The carpet was filthy and had not been vaccummed along the baseboards or corners. We would never stay there again!!!! I couldn't get out of there fast enough!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in details for what is promised”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: [Note to Priceline & other third-party guests] Like everyone else, 3rd-party customers read reviews and have expectations; exceptional attentiveness to guest needs is what distinguishes one 3 star from others. Third-party prices fill otherwise unsold rooms, and provide the hotel with opportunities to sell services and win future business. My advice to Priceline customers: pay attention to reviews, articulate your needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet and you bought from Priceline, tell Priceline in writing; use snail mail to the company’s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. I’ve found them very responsive. Talk to local management directly, pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational.] If you are buying on Priceline an airport-area hotel of 3-stars, this will generally be what you get for $45-$55 depending on season. COMMENDABLE: The E-W Light Rail fronts the hotel, right out the front door; it’s accessed by crossing at a close intersection with traffic signals. Clean basic rooms, airport shuttle, pleasant employees, functional computer for boarding passes in lobby; free functional wireless in rooms [many CPs charge for this}. The employee who handled my baggage to the room showed me controls and went to get ice. Excellent and reasonably-priced breakfast buffet with made-to-order egg options; the only bad thing was coffee, watered-down and old. Front desk employees helpful in recommending places to eat near Arizona Center. I went on rail, ate at Restaurant 1130, able there to find quiet and had a great server, Tino, and a lovely, perfect salad meal and the best housemade key lime pie ever. The hotel doesn’t charge for 1-800 calls. Quiet despite airport proximity. Temp controls on the unit, difficult to make comfortable. NEED FIXING: One person covers front desk at 5 AM, can’t do everything; the phone is slow to answer; I stood for 15 minutes waiting to check out and leave a package for Fedex. Employees shouldn’t ever be put in this position. Security finally roused the clerk. Bathroom break? Someone else can be cross-trained to cover for that break. Beginning at 8 pm, evening before I left, no hot water. Ditto middle-of-the-night, ditto at 5 AM. Mentioned at checkout; I was given a long explanation, boiling down to “the hotel knows” but “we don’t know why this happens” and “you have to run it a long time.” [Guys: 20 minutes of wasting water, following this advice, produces no hot water.] Engineering needs to solve this basic-needs problem so the clerks do not have to make excuses; it’s unacceptable for any hotel. Hotel web site and room literature offers small amenities, but a comb couldn’t be found. CHECK HOT WATER when you check in, or ask when you check in. If the problem is only happening in certain rooms, they will know which ones.

Reviews.Title: “Many Pluses”
Reviews.Author: Patrick1_10
Reviews.Content: Aging hotel but with the CP beds...worth the price by itself! Good staff, great location...light rail in front of hotel to take you downtown, shuttle to airport... You do not want to spend tons of time in the hotel but good place to stay if you have other things to do.

Reviews.Title: “MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR SHEETS”
Reviews.Author: ccovingto
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in preparation for an early flight the next morning (great location). We arrived late, got situated and climbed into bed. I commented to my husband that the sheets felt "gritty". After laying in bed for a while I got out to look at the sheets and found TONS of body hair and a bodily fluid stain. I called the front desk agent who offered to move us to a different room. Because it was late and we would have to gather all of our stuff, we didn't take this option and requested new sheets. The agent was very nice and brought a new set of sheets himself and all three of us changed them. He said he wasn't authorized to offer anything else but a couple of drink tickets. Upon checkout at 5:30 the next morning, I discussed this incident with the new agent who aware of the situation. She said that a note was left for the manager who would contact us. We were not contacted. I called the manager after our trip and she was unaware of what had happened. I was told that there was nothing other that switching rooms that could be done in this incident. Several ideas for improvement ..housekeeping use a checklist to make sure a complete room cleaning has been done (especiall if ..front desk agents empowered to do more that offer a couple of drink tickets ..improve line of communication between employees and managers ..more than one person scheduled at night so the front desk agent does not have to leave the desk unattended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: ken07641
Reviews.Content: We missed our connection in Phoenix late in the evening and the USAirways staff directed us to this Hotel, only a few minute shuttle ride from the Airport. The Hotel is conveniently near the airport (it's on a monorail stop) and is a typical clean, fairly spacious Crowne Plaza Hotel. Check-in was efficient and courteous, the Lobby was clean and nicely decorated as were the rooms. There was a very nice buffet breakfast with a made-to-order omlette station.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: clan4irish
Reviews.Content: Fairly typical Crowne Plaza, the amenities and staff were OK, the room was clean and comfortable, but I would highly recommend a room facing the street. The room I had faced the parking lot and from 5:30am to 7:30am I could hear the valets driving the cars through the garage and HONKING the car HORNS repeatedly at the blind corners in the structure. Now it may be a good safety practice, but it sure is irritable at 5:30 in the morning when I am on a leisure trip and was looking forward to sleeping in. When I was driving through the parking structure I noticed mirrors on the walls near the blind corners so you can SEE if opposite traffic is coming and HONKING the HORNS are not necessary. Not a very thoughtful valet crew.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise stay was MOST impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Rwheels
Reviews.Content: I needed to make a 'last-minute' reservation and unexpected stay on Sept 27, 2010 near the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. Front desk employee was Dana. She took the res from Denver, guided us to the connection in PHX, and checked us in. She gave us a discount (senior or AAA or whatever) and represented the Inn extremely well. Our room was the cleanest I've ever stayed in (and I travel frequently) which is the single most important priority for us. We haven't stayed in a Holiday Inn in years. We signed on to their rewards program and will NOW stay whenever we get the chance. Great job winning over customers and setting the bar high for friendliness, helpfulness, cleanliness and cost.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: keds58
Reviews.Content: The hotel has bed bugs. They moved us to another room, but didn't offer any compensation for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: From the doorman, to the reservation desk, lounge & cafe; everyone we met was cordial, helpful, and generous with hotel resources. Owners have obviously hired for pleasant personality and it works. Nice room, attractive and spotless pool, good food & handy location, with airport shuttle and directly opposite a stop on the new light rail system. Great value (off-season, anyway) and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “over the top service”
Reviews.Author: joburn1967
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff (Casie) outstanding !! First time in phoenix and unfortunately it was for a family emergency, had booked a different hotel closer to the hospital last minute, that was an absolute disaster.. My fiance called Crowne plaza (casie) while I was at the hospital and arranged for my stay at the Phoenix airport hotel instead of the bug infested property I had originally booked..The staff was more than accomodating and made you feel at home during an extremely stressful time..Rooms were extremely clean! Attitude from the bell staff, front desk, housekeeping, lounge and restaurant had made up my mind that I will definately stay in a Crowne Plaza whenever possible..Phoenix airport Hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel Welcome”
Reviews.Author: S0nad0r
Reviews.Content: My review may be slightly skewed, as I stayed here overnight after returning from Mexico, but it was nice to have a relaxing evening before getting on a plane early in the morning. The staff was very courteous, considering I was a little out of sorts from my Mexico excursion, and needed a shower upon arrival. Even the bell hop in the lobby stopped me after having showered to ask if I was feeling better than when I arrived! I appreciated that he even took the time to remember me, let alone show concern. After a quick meal, I returned to the room and quickly fell asleep. The mattress was solid, maybe a little firmer than I would have preferred. After having checked out via the TV, as I was walking through the lobby to get a Taxi, the front desk clerk asked how my stay was and if there was anything I was unsatisfied with. I'd definitely stay here again, as I find that customer service is important, and I appreciate the staff taking the time to make me feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: RaiderHop
Reviews.Content: I liked that the hotel was reasonably close to the airport, plus the free shuttle saved me from having to pay for a taxi. I'm a proponent of fine customer service, so I'm always keeping my eye out for situations where I can get the best service. I prefer to request early check-in to hotels so I can have the front desk staff to myself. Unfortunately, a morning flight was unavailable so I wasn't able to get to the hotel until the afternoon, which can be a difficult time for any front desk staff with all the people checking-in for that night. Despite this, the front desk staff was very friendly. In fact, I can't think of anyone I encountered who didn't give me great service. I was there for a conference and after being at some hotels lately with bad AV, I really liked the audio visual set up for our conference. The phrase "you get what you pay for" definitely did not apply to this hotel, because the value was excellent. I felt I had a great experience for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: faxman1975
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Phoenix in a couple years but I came to town to visit friends and see a D-Backs game and my stay went well. The airport shuttle was super convenient and the front desk staff was very helpful with arranging a conference call for me. The room was clean and I would definitely stay here again because it's so central to everything while stll being super close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Twenty_Centz
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing I can say is that the room was clean. First-off, got charged $4 a night to park my own car at the hotel, unsat. The television in the room was not at all up-to-par; it was very small, and the Interactive Checkout function did not work, after trying for the better part of fifteen minutes, and I had to Checkout thru the desk. The air conditioning unit in the room was so jet engine-esque loud (even on the Low fan setting), that it woke my son and I up no less than a half dozen times during the night. Then, the hotel's restaurant was inexplicably closed for breakfast the next morning, with a 'Sorry For The Inconvenience' note on the door, after having been open the night before. I am normally not an over-critical consumer, but this stay was easily the worst experience me & my family have ever had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Falling apart , bottle of urine in room!”
Reviews.Author: foodlover505
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Phoenix Airport Crowne Plaza because we received a good deal by booking online. Easily the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. All of the following happened on our first day. Our first room (#703) had an air conditioner that wasn't working and after maintenance examined it, was inoperable. No big deal, so our second room (#707) seemed fine, but when it was time to get ready for dinner, we discovered that there was no hot water. Maintenance came up again and alas, was unable to remedy the situation. After having moved twice already, we made sure to check everything in our third room (#708) across the hall. Things seemed to be looking up but when I opened the dresser drawer beneath the TV, I discovered a bottle of urine in a water bottle! Being in the lodging industry myself, I understand that certain maintenance issues arise, especially in an aging infrastructure. The urine was the last straw though. Because the general manager was gone for the weekend we were referred to two different managers on duty. We were given tickets for breakfast and some drink coupons to use at the hotel bar. It didn't make up for our horrible experience, but it was a nice gesture. Needless to say, all of this put a big damper on our weekend. The worst part about all of this was not receiving a reply from the general manager, Daron Brotherton, after writing him a letter explaining the ordeal. This lack of concern shows a cavalier disregard for the guests who stay at this hotel. It's also an unfortunate reflection on his business and personal work ethic. Shame, shame, shame.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Home - Very Comfortable - Caring Staff - Worked and Played at the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: TEAMRC-RICKandCLARE
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay for my husband and myself, as we needed to be close to the airport. It is a good hotel to stay at for business travel. The inside had some updating done to the common areas and looked quite nice with bright Arizona colors. The rooms were not bad and we slept really well as the beds and pillows were quite comfortable. Our first stay of this trip was on the 3rd floor. Our second stay was on the 8th floor and seemed to have more updating done to those rooms. We faced East and had the morning sun, but not a hot room to come back to at the end of the day. We were really impressed with the food. We were expecting average food, but apparently they have a chef or two, that really knows how to cook. This was our experience for breakfast, lunch and dinner meals. We love consistency! The dinner salads are great. So is the build a burger plate. The last night I had the salmon dinner. That was awesome! We really enjoyed Kristin in the lounge. She's a sweetie and took really good care of us. The drinks were good and there were a couple of flat panel tv's to enjoy as well. Eric in the restaurant is really great too. Kind of feels like your younger brother! We also met Sheila in the restaurant. She is the restaurant manager I believe. She is really nice too. The pool area was very comfortable. Each day we would go outside with our laptop and books (free wireless internet was great), while wearing our swimsuits. What a lifestyle! We would swim and work. Sometimes we had the whole pool area to ourselves. But usually there were only a few people around during the day. They have a couple of large umbrella tables for shade and a mixture of shade and sun areas for the lounge chairs. We had pool service each day, and would have our large dinner salads out at the pool, with our refreshing iced teas with lemon. I wish I was there right now, but unfortunately I am looking out my window on a cloudy / rainy day in the pacific northwest. :-( When we first arrived, we had an issue in the room that needed attention from the maid. We called Daron, the front desk manager, and he Immediately took care of it. He put Ann Marie, the Executive Housekeeper on the case, and she was amazing. She made sure we had everything we needed and more. We noticed the management is very attentive to your needs. You just need to let them know. We also noticed they have a free shuttle for the airport. And the light-rail stops across the street which is very convenient. As far as the area, it is an o.k. area of town. I wouldn't want to travel there with my kids. I think this hotel is best suited for adults and business travel. I am a big walker but found that I wasn't that comfortable walking in the neighborhood, so I stuck to swimming laps at the pool and working out at the hotel's fitness club, which was more than adequate for my exercise needs. All in all, we really had a great time, and will definitely be back. The staff I mentioned above were so warm hearted and welcoming, that we felt like we were at home and with family.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Starting with the friendly staff and ending with a great room, you cannot beat this hotel. The views are awesome, as I love watching planes take off and land. The outside and lobby are near pristine. A great hotel to book for business or pleasure. This is my hotel of choice every time I am in Phoenix!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: larson50
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport. Large lobby, but smaller room. Clean, dated, and the carpet getten worn like all the carpets in the hotel. Overall needs some updating. Metro (light traain) runs right beside the hotel, which made it easy to get west to downtown and east to other communities. Airport is close, and like all airport hotels, has that noise also. May keep some awake, but I didn't find it as bad as other airport hotels. Restaurant is at best average, and comp breakfast is also only average. Bar looks to have a large selection, but doesn't have anything exotic. Pool good, but the smaller hot tub is hot. Their hotel guide book states pool open to ten, but staff close it at nine. Some very friendly and helpful staff, but others less. I though I would splerge a bit on this trip, but it wasn't worth it. Overall overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, noisy, and outdated”
Reviews.Author: z75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport, which is why I chose to stay here one night. We were not arriving in Phoenix until 11:30 p.m. so I wanted something close to the airport. However, I should have spent a little more to stay somewhere nicer. The place looks like an office building. The front desk person could not tell us where the nearest restaurants were located. The room was dark (no natural light, very depressing) and in great need of an update. The air conditioner did not work, despite the noise. Overall. this was a disappointing Crowne Plaza experience.

Reviews.Title: “I RECOMEND IT”
Reviews.Author: InternationalAffairs
Reviews.Content: First time I stay there, and i would go back. Fills the basic needs. Proximity to the airport, free transportation, excellent service from the friendly staff, clean rooms, respectable food, cozy beds, and a big pool to lay back after a day's work. What you need, when you need it. Had no problems with my reservation and got straight down to bussines.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phlange
Reviews.Content: Suspected the toilet wasn't being cleaned, confirmed when I saw urine around the seat after lifting it up. Room verrry dusty behind bed and on the armoir. Anywhere that appeared to be hidden( I guess) by housekeeping. Not enough outlets in the room. doors slamming all night, every night (need to use something to keep their doors from slamming). Must I say more? Will never ever stay here again nor will I recommend anyone else to stay. Would have left but my longggg week pre-paid with priceline was non refundable!!!! Someone ordered room service and the dirty dishes sat outside the door for 3 day's (I counted). Same dishes in the same spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: S2ckholm
Reviews.Content: Almost seven years ago, we stayed at this hotel when it was a Holiday Inn, and at the time, we vowed never to stay again. What with our aging brains, not visiting in a long time, and the name change, we got faked out and booked it, since we are Priority Club members. Once the shuttle drew up, we realized our mistake. The lobby was very pretty, but the room was just as small and dirty as the one we had seven years ago. Plus, the bathroom floor was festooned with long black hairs from the previous occupant -- thank God we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Dump”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBenji
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Crowne Plaza chain before,so were shocked at what a dreadful place this one was. It was old, musty, gloomy, worn out and totally unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “RUN! RUN! as fast as you can!!!”
Reviews.Author: hhopper
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! My husband is a Priority Club Member and we have stayed at many Holiday Inns and Crowne Plazas and this was by far the worst EVER! From walking into the lobby the place reeked of smoke...of course Arizona Law states that you can't smoke within 15 feet of an entrance...so that is where all of the smokers stand and the automatic doors opening and closing so often the odor in the Lobby is horrible. Our check in Clerk was not even able to make eye contact with us, not a welcome nothing! We proceded to our room and my 10 year old walked in and said why did we get a smoking room? we trapsed back down the the Lobby and we were reassigned by a nicer female clerk to a new room. Much better on odor but the place is really worn. The hallways FILTHY as were the elevators. We went to get bottled water from the vending machine and it was empty, went down to the next floor and the same thing. Upon using the bathroom there was a big old swath of toothpaste across the faucet! EEK! we were really grossed out by this place. The train woke us up all night not to mention the fan system blasting on and off all night long! We didn't eat a thing there and would have left had we not pre-paid. We stayed a night at the Double Tree Guest Streets right down the street and it was GREAT! clean, nice rooms, really great little pub/restaurant, excellent friendly service. If you need an airport hotel STAY at the Doubletree!!

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorite Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sarah808
Reviews.Content: I splurged a bit on this hotel (though got a AAA rate), but it was worth it due to its proximity to Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, Arizona Mills Outlets, Desert Botanical Garden, as well as its 24-hour airport shuttle, comfortable bar and friendly wait staff. One of the stops along the Metro Light Rail is also right in front of the hotel, so if you don't have a car, it's quite convenient as a means of getting into town to visit the Phoenix Art Museum or Heard Museum, as well as various shops and restaurants. Check in was quite fast and the staff friendly as I asked questions about the marathon that was to take place the next day. Really appreciated my spacious king bed room with its sleeper sofa, coffee table, work desk, free wi fi, wardrobe with TV, microwave, small fridge and spacious granite bathroom vanity. Most of all, the bed was incredibly comfortable with lots of pillows and soft comforter. Upon check in, I had signed up for the Priority Club Rewards and from what I understand, this enabled me to get a better room. Another nice perk is that the room welcomed me with lights on, music playing on the clock radio and a nice snack bag of chips, apple, a fortune cookie and bottle of water. Not bad for just signing up! Being alone, I also enjoyed topping off both nights at their friendly Cafe Sha bar; the Citrus Salad was delicious! Happened to meet a few people and had great conversation to boot. Loved: the oh-so comfortable bed, convenience of location. Not so much: $4 daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a fair price, but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: Jeffontheroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decent for the price and is in a good location, but could use some updating. The elevators seem to be a bit rickety and the carpet in the halls is old and worn. The rooms have newer carpet but the bath seems a bit old. I was upgraded to the Concierge Level as a Priority Club Platinum and there was light snacks and a free continental breakfast in the mornings, but nothing to write home about. Certainly not up to par with Marriott's Concierge lounge that I get for free as a Gold Marriott member whether I get a room upgrade or not. But the price at this Crowne Plaza was much less than what a Marriott charges, so I can't complain too much. I was also given free parking as a priority club member... not sure if they only do that for priority club members. I saw a sign that said $6 for overnight guests. The hotel can be kind of noisy with the airport and train tracks nearby, but that's typical of any airpot hotel. The wireless internet works and is easy to use, but is kind of slow. The pool area was large, the pool was clean and the water was quite warm, which is nice for a stay in January. Bottom line, it's a nice clean hotel with comfortable beds for a fair price, but certainly not up to par with other Crowne Plaza's. I would stay again if nothing better was available for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: davidbourgette
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the hotel. its within a couple of mile to the rental car companies and airport so its great to stay at and catch a flight. The room was quiet and clean eventhough the bathroom could use some updating it was clean which to me is the most important thing. The bed was very comfortable, something I appreciate after a long day on the road. Room service was fast and good but as always expensive. My only prt preive is that they charge you $6/day to park in there garage. This is something that always bugs me...oh well. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One night and catch a flight”
Reviews.Author: Takemeaway79
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay before we flew home was a rewards night. When we got to the room at 10:30 at night, the lights were on and a small snack bag had been left (apple, chips, water). All very nice but at a price. It was Thanksgiving weekend and the lack of parking was a problem. Valet full and garage even had double parking blocking cars. We parked at a red (fire??) curb and the hotel advised us that it would be fine - and it was. There is not a fan only option on the heating system so we listenend to the fan go off and on all night. The bathroom does have a granite counter but is not scrupulously clean and a little tired appearing. Like we were in the a.m. before our early flight. The convenience to the airport was the biggest plus and I am glad the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: 8 story hotel just outside the gates of Phoenix Skyharbor Airport. A 5 minute drive. Generic on outside but inside was above average especially with the price I paid with Priceline. Liked the public computer/printer in foyer and free internet in room. Nice comfortable beds and granite bathroom counters with coffeemaker. Lower view below 6th floor obscured by parking garage but 7th had great sunset view of Phoenix. Check in was prompt and friendly. Liked TV check-out. If you want to be near airport it is a very good choice. Otherwise it is in a industrial/airport area. There is a historical museum across the street however. Not many places to eat so we drove 3 miles down Washington Street to Tempe and enjoyed the little strip there. There is a free shuttle service that would even take you to the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for one night.”
Reviews.Author: TeddyEdwardCornwall
Reviews.Content: After a long and unplesant flight from London the Crowne plaza was a welcome sight. Quick efficient check-in to a clean,comfortable room. We also had a drink in the bar and a meal in the restaurant both good. We booked this Hotel with Hotwire and got avery good price. We would use the Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for one night”
Reviews.Author: famof5s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for an early morning flight. Our first room had a weird smell so we had to move to another. The room was clean. The hotel itself is ok. The front desk was very efficient and handled our complaint promptly. It wasn't a bad overnight stay. Very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: PJandSJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in July. Check-in was friendly and impressively efficient. Unfortunately, the lift (i.e. the elevator) was not working, so the time gained at check-in was lost while staff searched for a lift that worked – an activity that took between five and ten minutes. It was presumably a temporary problem, because all the lifts worked perfectly OK for the remainder of our stay. The restaurant in the evening was fairly quiet, but the atmosphere was pleasant, the cuisine enjoyable and the staff attentive. The buffet breakfast was reasonably good, although the choice was less extensive than we’ve had at hotels of a comparable standard. Our “free” breakfast did not include orange juice, which seemed a rather bizarre, if minor, anomaly. The outside swimming pool was of a reasonable size and depth, with shade provided both by an awning and by a few small trees. However, ashtrays on tables in the pool area seemed not to be emptied during the day, which meant that some tables reeked of stale cigarettes. All in all, this was a reasonable hotel. Its main advantages are its proximity to the airport and the fact that the metro to downtown Phoenix stops just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Stokesfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad about this hotel but nothing to capture your attention either. Have stayed at other crowne plaza's and this one is below standard. The rooms are clean but dated. The location is convenient to the airport and that's it. Wasn't impressed with phoenix either but it seems Tempe (just up the street) is where it all happens.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: AustinT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and found the hotel to be fine. Sure there were some things that would not place this as a top Crowne Plaza but the staff were very attentive and accommodating. I booked a concierge room but on my arrival the room was closed so I was given free drink coupons for the bar and coupon for a free buffet breakfast. I had no problem checking in early (noon) and being allowed to check out late (3pm). The room had all the usual amenities and the bed was quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 2007sonata
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week. We had a difficult check-in process, which seems to be normal for any employee at my company who stay at the hotel. We were issued free breakfast passes which eased our minds off the difficult check-in. Hopefully this billing issue will be worked out in the future. The room was pretty nice, very clean and comfortable. There were plenty of towels and basic toiletries in the room. The bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping did what they were supposed to, putting in clean towels, making the bed. The television had basic free channels, but everything else you have to pay for. I tried the free Internet access in my room and it worked fine. If you didn't bring your laptop and you need to print boarding passes or whatever, there are some computers hooked up to the Internet in the lobby. My room overlooked the parking garage as well as one of the runways for the airport. This meant listening to airplanes taking off from time to time. A little annoying, but the air conditioner will mask that noise if you have it running. For breakfast, they offer a buffet from 6 AM to 10 AM which has an egg station, cereals, French toast, bagels, fresh fruit, bacon, and even a waffle maker. The staff was very nice as well. In addition to having issues with check-in, other cons include: the hotel elevators need their carpet replaced desperately and they should try to vacuum the hallways more often. It smelled like mold or something as I was walking down the hall to my room. Even adding perhaps a scented plug-in or something would've helped. The parking garage elevator was off-line one day for painting so everybody had to use the stairs which probably haven't been cleaned in years. It may make sense to sweep the stairs every now and then. I tried the room service one night. My food was delivered within 15 minutes literally. The quality of the food was okay, although the french fries I ordered were pretty bland. Unfortunately, when I called to have my tray removed after finishing my dinner, nobody bothered to show up so I had to keep the tray in my room overnight and left the cleaning staff the responsibility of getting the tray back to the restaurant (Cafe Sha). We went to the bar one night for drinks and food. The bartender was really nice and the food was really good as well. At $149 per night, I think this hotel was a little overpriced for what we got, but the location is very convenient to my workplace and the airport. You also have the choice of using the light rail for transportation throughout the city, there is a station right in front of the hotel (very convenient). You Could Opt to avoid getting a rental all together if you don't mind taking the light rail. Hotel has a tiny convenience store with overpriced items, so I would go elsewhere for that stuff, there is a Circle K across the street. The hotel has a small fitness room and a pool - neither of which I had time to try, but they were available.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: erinys
Reviews.Content: Not sure why my experience was so much better than that of other reviewers, but it genuinely was. Perhaps because my airline had done me so very wrong nothing else could possibly be worse. My airline had to put me up here overnight due to the incompetence of a gate attendant many, many hours earlier on the east coast. The shuttle was a little slow, but it was midnight. Check-in was fast and smooth, the desk attendant very polite and helpful. There were earplugs, but I never heard a peep of airplane noise (but I live 2 miles from an Air Force base). The room was in great shape, extremely attractive, but with an awful view. I love taking baths and since I'd been on the road for 24 hrs already I was thrilled that the bathroom made my cleanliness cut for being safe to lay down and soak. The tub drained slowly, but it wasn't a problem with the next monring's shower. The bed was very comfortable, the lack of a flat screen tv was somewhat disappointing. Breakfast is normally about $14, and was an excellent value, with unlimited access to fresh sausage, bacon and omelettes in addition to the usual fruits and breads. The ice maker on my floor didn't work, and management should remind the cleaning staff that just because someone doesn't look like they understand Spanish, they just might.

Reviews.Title: “old hotel with very slow shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: NCreviewer
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I should confess that American Airlines sent me to this hotel after canceling my flight, so I did not enter in the best of moods (but see my review of the Grand Hyatt DFW, which I loved in a similar situation). I should have just paid and stayed someplace better. First, I felt treated like a second-class citizen for having an airport voucher - they would not allow me to make a reservation but instead I had to be a walk-in, meaning that I had to wait for a shuttle without knowing whether or not I would get a room. I called for the shuttle, and was told it would take 5-20 minutes. 35 minutes later, still no shuttle. A limo driver told me their shuttle was completely unreliable and that I should just take a cab - so I called back and was told it was close. Finally, I gave up and took a taxi - I had to pay the taxi driver $20 to convince him to give up his place in the airport line to drive to a hotel only 1 mile away. When I walked in I knew it would be bad - dated, old. The guy at the front desk was nice and gave me a free drink coupon to make up for the shuttle, but after I rode in the old elevator I didn't want to go back down in it. too sketchy. Then I ordered room service - they kindly agreed to make me a grilled cheese (which wasn't on the menu), but the food was inedible when it came. They put saran wrap over it and the heat trapped made both the sandwich and fries completely inedible. they did have a surprisingly good wine list for such a run-down hotel, although the glass I had tasted as if it had been open for a while. It is noisy - they provide ear plugs and a CD and tips for sleeping. The noise was airplane noise, though, which I do find easier to deal with than loud voices (I think trains were also passing by). For some reason the place just sketches me out. But everyone I interacted with (except for the person on the phone) was very nice to me.

Reviews.Title: “Run ... fast”
Reviews.Author: kat1972
Reviews.Content: If you're even considering staying here, forget it. First of all, the location: the rail system directly outside is dangerous (a reported stabbing before our arrival); adult entertainment venues up and down the street; and a Ruby Tuesday and a Circle K are your only options for food (and you'd better run ... to say the area isn't safe would be an understatement). Next, the rooms: I've never stayed at a hotel with more inconsistent housekeeping service. No hair dryer (it had been ripped off the wall); no iron; basket missing from coffeemaker; and no clock. Vending machines on each floor advertised bottled water, but machines on several floors contained no water. A couple of colleagues traveling with me reported no hot water in their room, while others reported mold growing on the wall in theirs. I repeatedly asked that my bedding be changed, and my requests were ignored (I know this because the yellow paint on my sheets remained there throughout the week). Strangely enough, I was provided "turn-down" service with chocolates on the pillow my first night there -- but not the other four nights I was at the hotel. Carpets were dirty and hadn't been vacuumed in ages, particularly near the beds. Coffee mugs and glasses were not replaced each day, and housekeeping left a two-way phone in my room (I should have used it to ask for clean sheets!). Several of my colleagues and I came down with a mysterious stomach illness while staying at the hotel. When I went to the front desk to ask for Pepto Bismol, I was charged $2 for the privilege. Run, my fellow travelers, run .....

Reviews.Title: “It's close to the airport. Beyond that . . .”
Reviews.Author: rode_hard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in worse hotels, but this would probably fall into the "top" 15. Even though it looks like it went through recent some renovations or upgrades it still felt worn, dated and tired. The hotel staff ranged from very helpful and friendly to indifferent with an attitude. This typically indicates a lack of training. Housekeeping was also inconsistent. Sometimes my room was made up sometimes not. It took several days of asking before I got my cleaning. They knew it was around somewhere, but it took awhile to find it. The location is close to the airport and that is about all that it has going for it. Other immediate neighbors include tire stores, the dog track and a variety of adult entertainment options. I guess it all depends on what you are looking for. It is important to note that the new light rail system stops immediately across the street from the property. This gives guests without a car options to get out of the immediate area easily.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: You other Trip Advisors are dead on (aren't we always?). This place is simply another vanilla-issue charmless airport hotel. It's not bad, but it's not great. This property used to be a Holiday Inn Select. A couple years ago, they slapped on some new paint and they now call it a Crowne Plaza. There really isn't a whole lot to say. I mean it's like trying to describe a piece of white bread that's been sitting out for a couple days. Got it? If you get a really cheap deal, go for it. Otherwise, look on.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Crowne Plaza???”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I usually love staying at Crowne Plaza, but this hotel was disappointing. The front desk staff was helpful and went out of way to help with directions and services but could not compensate for slightly shabby lobby and room that was well worn. Halls worn and had some unvacuumed areas, room small and overlooking parking lot, curtains clipped shut. Slightly stale smell. Tears in wallpaper covered with some paint or something, okay bed but just not what I am used to from this hotel chain. One of the elevators was out of service, but no sign, another guest told use we may as well quit waiting. Ice machine on our floor not working. No complimentary coffee in lobby for early departure though small coffee pot in room and coffee, but water was not available and tap water not so good here for coffee. Shuttle to airport was great, ontime and fast. Internet available. Computer in lobby with worn and dirty keys - well it was there and free but get me some sanitizer. Hall walls thin, as I was unlocking the door to my room I could hear fingernail clipping in the room across the hall. Yikes. Fortunately the guest staying the night I did were quiet guests, otherwise I think it could have been a long night. At a budget hotel I would expect what I found but not a Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWorldInADay
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Crowne Plaza I have ever visited. Although the hotel was renovated at some point, as evidenced by the lobby and some updates to the room decor, this hotel is not one that I would recommend. Upon reaching the airport, it took over 20 minutes for the shuttle to show up after I called the hotel. Since I arrived at night, I thought this was a little long considering a key selling point of this hotel is that it is an "airport" hotel. I had emailed the hotel my requests related to my room, as I am a light sleeper and need quiet to sleep through the night. I am also a member of the hotel chain's loyalty program. No one responded to my email, which was sent through the property's website at least one week prior to my arrival. After discussing my preferences with the front desk person upon arrival at the property, I was given a room on the "quiet" floor. In the first two minutes in the room, I heard train whistles blaring. OK, let's try another room... The next room features the delightful sounds of aircraft engines. I have stayed at other airport properties (including one at LHR) before and have not heard this much noise. I don't think this property is familiar with the concept of sound-proof or double-glazed windows. I suppose that I should just be grateful for the earplugs and the "Sleep Advantage" CD in the room. The room is too dark. The lamps do not provide enough light. The lighting in the bathroom is also too dark. The light fixture in the bathroom has a broken covering, too. Now here's the gross part. I always request two beds, even when I travel solo because the beds are not always up to my standards. I figure with two beds if something is wrong with one, I still have another. Well, in my room at the Crowne Plaza, the first bed has someone else's hair on it. I am not talking about one random strand that may have fallen off the housekeeper as she was making the bed. I am talking about several hairs of different lengths and textures. There is no way that someone could have made that bed and not seen all of that hair on the white sheet -- especially since the hair was jet black!!! The other bed did not show any obvious filth, and given the late hour of my check in tonight (and being on my second room in this hotel), I chose to use the second bed and plan to address the housekeeping issue with management in the morning. There is one bright spot -- the free wireless internet! What an overall disappointment! There are many hotel options in Phoenix, I recommend you avoid this one!
